speaker: Herald Arena
line: Stone tiers rise around a pit scarred by old contests. The crowd is thin, but their attention is sharp enough to cut.

speaker: Hollow Herald
line: Prove the mark upon you was earned, not stolen. The city loves a thief—until it needs a scapegoat.

speaker: Hollow Herald
line: Then speak: why do you chase authority? To save, to rule, or to be forgiven?

choices.text: To save people who were never protected.
To end the machines of control.

speaker: Hollow Herald
line: Good. Intent is not innocence—but it’s a beginning. The King will want to hear you make that claim where it matters.

choices.text: Where do I find the King?

speaker: Herald Arena
line: A hush spreads through the tiers. You can feel the city adjusting around your words, like a lock turning one notch closer to opening.
